image.altText: A young boy in a hoodie walks out of a police paddy wagon with a female police officer standing nearby.

props.synopsis: Police say seven young people arrested as part of counterterrorism investigation into Wakeley stabbing attack share a  "religiously motivated violent extremist ideology".

title.children: 'No immediate danger': Children arrested by counterterrorism police in raids across Sydney

image.altText: A profile image of a woman with long, ice blonde hair. She has a slight smile on her face.

props.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns says he has requested that Attorney-General Michael Daley review the circumstances leading up to the alleged murder of 28-year-old Molly Ticehurst this week.

title.children: NSW premier flags potential AV links for serious bail hearings after alleged murder of central west woman

props.synopsis: The eSafety commissioner and social media platform X are back in Federal Court to debate the status of posts featuring footage of the Wakeley church attack.

title.children: Bishop Emmanuel wants footage of his stabbing in church to stay online, court hears

image.altText: NRL player Terry Hill running with the ball under his arm, looking ahead at the defence.

props.synopsis: Terry Hill, one of the best centres in Australian rugby league in the 1990s, has died aged 52.

title.children: Former Kangaroo and NSW Origin player Terry Hill dies

image.altText: Image of two saddled horses, one black, one white, running through the street. The white horse has blood on its hooves.

props.synopsis: Army horses that were seen galloping through central London at rush hour on Wednesday have been contained, police and media reports say.

title.children: Escaped army horses bolt through central London, four people injured

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann speaks to 7NEWS Spotlight in an interview.

props.synopsis: Australian Federal Police commissioner Reece Kershaw told the National Press Club today police were reviewing the matter to see whether an investigation was needed into how an image of Brittany Higgins's text messages came to be in the possession of the Seven Network.

title.children: Police reviewing how image of Brittany Higgins's texts was obtained by Seven ahead of Bruce Lehrmann interview

image.altText: Two  women walk past the Reserve Bank of Australia headquarters, with the building's name prominent in the background.

props.synopsis: Inflation has come in higher than expected during the March quarter, with prices rising by 1 per cent and annual inflation slowing to 3.6 per cent — reducing the possibility of the Reserve Bank cutting interest rates later this year.

title.children: 'Can't write off the possibility' of a rate hike, economist warns, as inflation comes in higher than expected

image.altText: A man in a beanie with a beard and nose piercing.

props.synopsis: Damon James Turnbull-Fielding was watching an instructional YouTube video while driving his vehicle on NSW's Central Coast during 2021 when he failed to negotiate a right-hand turn and fatally struck a 68-year-old cyclist.

title.children: Driver who fatally hit cyclist while watching YouTube on his phone handed two-and-a-half year sentence

image.altText: Dr Amireh at her desk seeing a patient.

props.synopsis: Law firms involved in the case said it was the largest underpayment class action outcome in Australian legal history.

title.children: 'I did this for a cultural change': Doctor's underpayment fight leads to $230m settlement

image.altText: A Richmond player looks emotional as he stands on the ground while a medic puts her hand on his arm.

props.synopsis: There's plenty of feeling at the MCG but the Demons have the advantage with a quarter to go — can the Tigers overcome a key player injury to find a way back? Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Demons hit the front, Tigers lose injury-hit star at MCG

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tigers strike first in final quarter
3QT: Nankervis' blunder cruels Tigers on siren

image.altText: Royal Flying Doctor Service plane on red dirt runway, being unloaded of medical supplies

props.synopsis: Two years after a scathing report was handed down, a parliamentary committee touring the health system in Far West New South Wales says it must work "harder and a lot smarter" to attract and retain healthcare professionals.

title.children: Outback NSW health services are in 'crisis' and rely too heavily on fly-in locums, inquiry chair says

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: Childcare worker and mother Molly Ticehurst was found dead in a regional New South Wales home on Monday morning. The Forbes local was 28 years old. And, she was the 25th woman to die from gender-based violence in Australia this year.

title.children: Samantha Murphy was 13th, Hannah McGuire the 18th: The violent deaths of women this year is a 'crisis'

image.altText: Former teacher Gaye Grant leaves the NSW Court of Criminal Appeal in Sydney with face mask and black hat

props.synopsis: Gaye Grant has been sentenced to at least three years and four months in prison after she admitted to having a sexual relationship with a boy between 1977 and 1979.

title.children: Paedophile female teacher fights to have conviction quashed after court rules law did not apply to women

image.altText: Man standing with motorcycle

props.synopsis: Mates Barry Holland and Ross Stewart died after they were struck by a father of two who had been using methylamphetamine to combat fatigue, a court has heard.

title.children: Motorcyclists' crash deaths leave families devastated as ice-affected shearer jailed

image.altText: A phone displaying the meta logo sits on a computer keyboard

props.synopsis: The launch of Meta's artificial intelligence tool has generated a wave of confusion among users as the AI bots descended upon familiar social media apps and began interacting with real people. Here are five quick questions on what the new tool means for users.

title.children: Meta AI has rolled out on our social media apps to a mixed reception. Here's why and what to do with it

image.altText: A man in a patterned shirt stands against a graffitied wall.

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day! Professor Jioji Ravulo explains how sharing his money with his extended family was part of life from his very first pay cheque and why, even now, he's always on the hunt for a good bargain.

title.children: Growing up in public housing taught Jioji Ravulo the art of budgeting. His number one tip: Always buy the specials

image.altText: A police car flashes its lights in front of police tape. Behind is a car on its head with smashed windows.

props.synopsis: NT Police have now arrested everyone who allegedly fled the scene of a car crash last month in Alice Springs. The fallout from the incident has been linked to the social unrest that led to the recent youth curfew in the town.

title.children: Police arrest eight people who allegedly fled fatal car crash in Alice Springs

image.altText: An Australian Border Force officer, with badge in foreground, holds a passport in background.

props.synopsis: ABF Commissioner Michael Outram has apologised to female staff in the marine unit, after a workplace review found sexual harassment and discrimination are so widespread, that "immediate intervention" is needed.

title.children: ABF commissioner apologises after sexual harassment and discrimination found within Border Force's marine unit

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in court next to his lawyer Todd Blanche

props.synopsis: A former newspaper publisher outlines how he bought and buried negative stories about Donald Trump, and the former president's lawyer is chastised by a judge, as the "hush money" criminal trial continues in New York.

title.children: 'You're losing all credibility,' judge tells Trump's lawyer, and other key moments from the 'hush money' trial

image.altText: Meg O'Neill and Richard Goyder sitting and speaking to the media

props.synopsis: Woodside is being forced to defend its climate transition plan, with the gas giant's shareholders rejecting it.

title.children: 'Ignoring the science': Woodside shareholder revolt sees climate plan rejected

image.altText: A woman in a blue cardigan and purple skirt sits at a bus stop

props.synopsis: Baby Reindeer is currently the most watched TV title on Netflix but some fans are taking the real life story of a stalker and the man she stalked too far.

title.children: Baby Reindeer is a nuanced look at trauma; it’s also inspiring fans to dox women

image.altText: woman smiles at camera standing inkitchen with stairs leading up to her left

props.synopsis: Coby Koster found her way out of the rental market by purchasing a tiny home but says planning hiccups among local governments are holding other people back.

title.children: Councils explore cutting red tape for tiny homes with big planning requirements

image.altText: a blonde woman wearing glasses touches the shoulders of two aboriginal women wearing traditional face paint

props.synopsis: The family of Pukumani Alimankinni, who died inside the Royal Darwin Hospital's secure mental health unit in 2021, have performed an emotional tribute on the final day of a coronial inquest into her death.

title.children: Emotional scenes as family of Tiwi Islands woman performs tribute on final day of inquest

image.altText: a small bay of water under blue skies with rocks at the bottom of the frame

props.synopsis: The mysterious appearance of a sandy beach at a bay in Sydney's east has caused intrigue for decades, and after a series of large swells it is gone once again.

title.children: Beach days are over for lovers of ephemeral Sydney swimming spot after sand disappears in stormy weather

image.altText: Orpheus Pledger running his hand through his hair with denim jacket over his shoulder.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police are searching for Orpheus Pledger after he failed to present to court. The Home and Away star is facing several assault charges.

title.children: Victoria Police search for Home and Away actor, charged with assault, who failed to appear at a Melbourne court

image.altText: A photo of a woman sitting in a brightly lit restaurant

props.synopsis: A Perth man is on trial for murder after he allegedly used a claw hammer to kill his lover, a nurse who was eight months pregnant with his baby.

title.children: Heavily pregnant nurse killed by lover with claw hammer after she refused to abort his baby, court told

image.altText: Aerial view of an airbase with a runway surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Locals are alarmed that Chinese men dropped on a remote beach were able to enter an Australian air base undetected, given the ramping up of surveillance along the crocodile-infested coastline.

title.children: Despite increased surveillance, Chinese men walked onto a northern Australian airstrip

image.altText: Prince William and Princess Catherine attend a ceremony. Catherine is wearing a large red hat.

props.synopsis: The Prince and Princess of Wales thank the public for messages marking the sixth birthday of their youngest son Louis, who beams at the camera in a portrait taken by his mother.

title.children: Prince William and Princess Kate release first family photo taken by Kate since photoshop controversy

image.altText: Composite image of Brittany Higgins and Defence Minister Linda Reynolds

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds sues her former political staffer Brittany Higgins and Ms Higgins's partner David Sharaz for defamation over a series of social media posts — and neither side appears willing to back down.

title.children: While all eyes have been on the failed Bruce Lehrmann defamation case, another legal drama is playing out in WA

image.altText: The main characters in The Idea of You about to kiss, headshot, embrace

props.synopsis: While promoting her new film The Idea of You, actor Anne Hathaway described as 'gross' previous practices she's been subjected to involving chemistry auditions where she had to kiss a long list of potential co-stars, one after the other.

title.children: Oscar-winner Anne Hathaway kissed '10 guys' in chemistry audition in a practice she describes as 'gross'

image.altText: an Indigenous elder standing on mud flats looking off the frame pensively

props.synopsis: Aquaculture operators starting out in the industry need to spend close to $500,000 on the development application process, involving the same level of scrutiny as for a new mine or major road infrastructure.

title.children: Regenerative kelp and mussel farmers angry about facing same planning costs as coal mines

image.altText: A boy with a blurry face holds a phone, the light illuminating his face against the darkened background.

props.synopsis: Sam was shocked to discover her son had been badgering a peer for nudes. Teen educator Bec Sparrow and clinic psychologist Dr Sophie Li had some advice for her.

title.children: Sam found out her son had hassled a girl for nudes, but she wasn't sure what to do next

image.altText: A wide shot of the city of Athens that is covered in orange dust.

props.synopsis: Video footage shows skies over southern Greece turning an orange hue as dust clouds blown from North Africa engulf the Acropolis and other landmarks in Athens.

title.children: Greek skies turn orange as dust clouds roll in from Sahara Desert
